I used to think I was an introvert, then I realized I'm just a socially awkward extrovert. I'm a teacher too, so I get along great with the students... But not so much with the other teachers. It's a strange existence.
How indecisive I am about important things.

Do research on the school/district and tell them why you're excited to work there instead of talking about your old school. They'd rather hear why you're excited to work with and learn from them. Never gripe, it looks unprofessional.
Sometimes when I wake up particularly anxious I'll have three loose movements within an hour. So yes.
In Southern California, Target is even more popular than Walmart.
More like deeply asleep bunny...
https://youtu.be/TgqiSBxvdws

There's never a bad time to start therapy. I know for me, it helps me sort out my feelings and feel a little more sane. It may do the same for you. Sure talking to friends and family helps, but they're not professionally trained to help people work through anxiety.
Additionally, if you're on meds that aren't helping you then you should revisit your psychiatrist. Good luck, and I hope you're able to enjoy your special day even through all of the calamity.
English spot, possibly lionhead because of the floofiness. Looks like my Fluffy girl, except Fluffy has a furry mohawk mane.
OMG thank you... I didn't realize that was a thing. Sorry that happened to you.

Therapy helped me a lot.
I also started revealing some of my racing thoughts to my husband when I was feeling particularly awful. It was cathartic for me and hopefully helped him understand me better, but not everyone can handle that.

You need to see a psychiatrist and therapist ASAP if you're having suicidal thoughts. Although your ex helps you feel safe, he is not professionally trained. Seeing a random person about this is scary, but worth it in the end. ::Hugs::
Source: Diagnosed with GAD and depression, took Zoloft and saw a therapist successfully for a year which turned my life around. AMA.

WRITING.TITLE: Daily Acid Reflux
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi all. With my psychiatrist's help, I recently weaned off the Zoloft I've taken for the past year to help with my GAD and depression. I have recently started having acid reflux multiple times throughout the day from the time I wake up to when I go to sleep, with breaks during the day when I'm too busy to think about it. It's terrible and makes me nauseous. During my depressive episode before the Zoloft, I developed IBS but that felt very different.
I'm not sure if it's related to coming off Zoloft, a dietary thing, or connected to my anxiety. It's really been bothering me and my next check in with my psychiatrist isn't until next Wednesday. What do you guys think? Have any of you had experiences with something like this?
Edit: There is a slim chance that my digestive issues are being caused by Acticlate which I am taking for my acne, but it would still be nice to know if anyone else here has experienced this due to anxiety. My GAD makes me a bit of a hypochondriac and I never know what to believe.
The release date is March 3rd which is a Friday, but do they mean late Friday night or late Thursday night for the midnight release?

WRITING.TEXT: Teaching is a profession of passion. No one can tell you whether or not you'll be a good teacher, it's about whether or not your heart is in it. Even if the kids walk all over you because you're nice, classroom management skills can be learned if you have the right mindset.

This is a great recommendation. Subbing can help you become familiar with different age levels and give you a feel for how much you enjoy teaching. You also have the ability to make your own schedule at some places, so you can go to school at the same time.
Get a dress with pockets!

Nordstrom sells Freya brand molded (that's the word they used instead of padded) bras that might work well for you. I'm a 30E who used to wear push up 34B bras, mainly because I have very pointy nipples.

I broke down crying for hours this one day. My principal told me to go to the doctor where I was diagnosed with Generalized Anxiety Disorder and major depression. I managed with meds, 2 weeks of mandated group therapy when I want allowed to work, individual therapy, and by leaving that particular school.

I taught kindergarten and gave a test on rhymes. The students heard a word, then told me one that rhymed with it.
When I gave the word door, he answered whore.

I was that kindergartner who said she wanted to be a teacher when she grew up. Great teachers inspired me, and I envisioned myself as Miss Honey from Matilda. Being the teacher's pet and helper only confirmed how much I loved helping others.
My mom was a daycare provider, so teaching kindergarten came naturally to me, but I've taught K-5.
My husband usually cooks for both of us and his doctor has him on a low cholesterol diet, therefore I too am on a low cholesterol diet.

I have been drinking more soda lately, so that may be part of the problem. I have also been avoiding meat and eating more fish as part of a lower cholesterol diet.
My eczema right now shows up as small dry patches on my legs, but I haven't noticed anything on my face. Is it possible that my eczema is somehow connected to me having more pimples on my face?

I have an appointment with a dermatologist, but the soonest appointment I could make was in January so I have to figure out what to do until then.
My pimples themselves can be itchy, so I worry that if I'm not regularly cleaning that they will only get worse. Do you recommend that I cut out certain parts of my routine?
I don't feel more stressed, but my diet has changed. My husband just found out he has high cholesterol so we've been sticking to foods with low cholesterol, but I'm not sure if that would affect my face at all. I have been drinking more soda lately and am trying to cut that out starting this week.

I have had eczema all of my life. Although I haven't had flare-ups in a long time, I used to get it on my eyelids. This means I am especially sensitive to products.
After reading some posts here, I think I have oily but dehydrated sensitive skin. I have never had this much acne before, and I have had some of the same pimples on my face for the past few months - they just seem to spread to other areas instead of clearing up. I tried using the Retin-A Micro my doctor gave me a few years ago, but that doesn't seem to help either. Nothing seems to work and I'm tired of having skin that is itchy and hurting all the time.
My current skincare routine:
Morning: - Aveeno ultra-calming foaming cleanser - Aveeno ultra-calming daily moisturizer with spf 15
I currently wear Bare Minerals liquid foundation and concealer during the day while I am at work, but am also open to suggestions for other make-up brands.
Night: - Aveeno ultra-calming makeup removing wipes

Platform: PC

Rank: 41-44

Looking for: Semi-serious casual, and decent competitive players (I've been burned by too many bad teams as support when I solo queue)

As someone resigned to teaching at a crappy, unorganized charter school for 7 years I'm happy to say that I'm starting my first district job this year! I just signed the contract and got my ID yesterday. Only downside is I'll be teaching 3rd instead of Kinder like I really wanted.

I don't get a lot of love as Lucio either, and I'm normally on fire for 75% of my Lucio games so I know it's not me. People don't understand that Lucio only heals within his LOS and can only boost that so much. It's a different kind of healing than people are used to.

You will become a surrogate parent to many of your students this year, so you need to stay patient and consistent. Expect students to be dependent on you, but encourage independence. Their joy and love is infectious. After their initial shyness wears off, your days will be full of fun - teaching Kindergarten is like a marathon and you need to pace yourself or you will burn out. I taught Kindergarten for three years and loved it. If you have any questions or need any tips/resources, I'd be happy to share even more with you!

I've been playing PC FPS (CS:GO, TF2, LFD2, Overwatch) for 6 years and it is a crapshoot. Sometimes I play random servers, but for the most part I play in servers where I know they are cool with me. I get to know the guys and have lots of fun. Even on servers I've vetted there are trolls, but I have learned to shit talk with the best of them. The mods tend to help out a lot in that area too. Of the games I've played, Left for Dead 2 was the worst.

WRITING.TITLE: "Are you OK?"
WRITING.TEXT: I noticed a strange phenomena at work lately. When I'm feeling really down, most of my co-workers leave me alone. But on my better days, more people come up to me and ask if I'm OK. I can't figure out why this is.

Right now it feels like when I haven't preoccupied my mind with Netflix, video games, or researching GAD and depression over the internet I am obsessing over how much I have messed up with my class this year. Figuring out "when" will be a challenge.

I just went to the doctor last Thursday too and was diagnosed with Generalized Anxiety Disorder and Major Depression, so I know what you're going through. Haven't started the meds yet, but that should be happening in a few days as well.
This is my 6th year teaching and this year has been really rough in terms of discipline for me as well. I've realized that it's hard to be firm and consistent with your students when you are being so hard on yourself. It's impossible to demand respect from your students when you don't even respect yourself right now. All of that will come with time and the support that you need.
I was also wondering if the doctor had recommended any kind of therapy so you can talk out your problems. I'm supposed to be starting tomorrow, and the idea of figuring out my anxiety with like-minded people is something I look forward to. If not, you should definitely look into it.
Feel free to PM me if you want. I'll be off work for the next two weeks getting used to the meds and going to group therapy during the day with not much else to do...

Telling them off is pretty much impossible for me.
Thank you for sharing your story, it helps me feel like things can get better. Focusing on me will be difficult, though.
Do you still visit counselors now when things are rough?
That's rough, I'm sorry. Maybe on the weekends?
My doc has prescribed antidepressants so I'll be starting those, but thanks for the other suggestions. I'll also be attending group therapy - crossing my fingers!
I definitely am, thank you. Group therapy starts tomorrow.

I'll have to get used to being on meds while I'm at work. I'm also a terrible liar - I just asked the principal to say I was out sick. The thought of going back terrifies me enough for me to start looking for new jobs, more so because it's a toxic environment for me than because of the fear of talking about the anxiety/depression.
I will definitely check out /r/anxiety - thank you!

This is my 6th year teaching and I feel the same way right now.
While I was teaching Kindergarten, I felt like I was doing something worthwhile when I saw the smiles on their faces and got hugs daily. It means a lot to feel loved and appreciated.
This year working with moody 5th graders and a co-teacher who treats me like her aide has just been too much. I even have a parent this year who is trying her hardest to get me fired based on awful things her child says I said to him. She claims he remembers everything and that I must be lying. I'm so tired of the stress - from the adults even moreso than the kids. It may be enough for me to consider changing professions.
Thanks!
Make sure you take time out to get help too so you can end the year strong!

The therapist who diagnosed me figured out right away that I had anxiety. I've been an anxious person for as long as I can remember, but it's just gotten worse through the years. It was one of the reasons I was diagnosed with Major Depression instead of it just being a result of life adjustments. Honestly, I'm excited to start therapy because I'm tired of being anxious all the time (even though when I get there I will probably refuse to participate or say anything).

The saddest thing is that I don't know if I'll be happy to go back to my 5th graders, and I don't know if they'll be happy to see me. Part of the stress has been moving from Kindergarten to 5th grade within the course of a year. I had worked with 5th grade like 7 years ago and had a rough time, but my principal pretty much forced me into it because she knows that every year the 5th grade teachers quit at our school. Before this, I was a successful and happy Kindergarten teacher for 3 years running. It makes me feel like a terrible person knowing that I just don't like working with 5th graders, but at the same time I wonder if that's the depression or just me.

I hope you're right and that everyone at school can be understanding. For now, I've asked the principal to just tell everyone I'll be out sick (in a generic way). When I tried going to people for help before and during the nervous breakdowns though, I got a lot of advice that I should just suck it up and work harder to get through it. When I tried to express my feelings and be assertive, I just pissed people off. Part of me just really wants a fresh start away from the mess.

One of the good things about being a first year teacher is that everyone knows how tough it is and for the most part you get extra support and check-ins. As a 6th year teacher who is also a part time teacher coach providing that new teacher support, it's a whole other beast...
Group therapy starts next week and I am waiting for the antidepressant prescription to go through. But today, I am sitting at home guilty about the fact that I am not at work.
I hope so. I've actually considered going back to school to become a School Psychologist, and the experience would definitely prove useful if I went that route.

I think you have a lionhead English Spot mix - like me! My bun [Fluffy](https://scontent-sea1-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xaf1/v/t1.0-9/11143292_10103390360512211_1858750454105421186_n.jpg?oh=4e87e3b0182e87a030c4c5c5561b6b07 oe=573FC5C0) looks a lot like yours, except her spots are more grey/brown.

I think my girl Fluffy does the same thing. When she pees outside of the box, it's usually in the same spot and a few days before we change the litter. It's her way of expressing her displeasure with the situation.

WRITING.TITLE: Teacher with Depression
WRITING.TEXT:
Today I was diagnosed with an episode of major depression and anxiety. It has been a rough school year for me with a lot of changes that brought me to the point of uncontrollable crying for two days in a row, migraines, muscle tension, and an inability to really get any work done with my students. My principal suggested I take the day to go to the doctor, and now I'll be out for over two weeks attending group counselling sessions and starting antidepressants.
Everyone is telling me that I need to take care of myself now, but I can't help feeling guilty. I feel I am letting everyone down and worry that I still won't be of any use when I return in a few weeks. This is supposed to make me feel better, but all I can think about is how awkward it will be when I return. What will my coworkers and students think?
Has anyone else on this subreddit been through a similar situation?

I grew up in Gardena and there are a lot of different micro-cultures within the city.
One of my favorite facts about Gardena is that many Japanese immigrated to the city, so there are a lot of fantastic Japanese restaurants. It's what I miss most about living there! Definitely look up the Shinsengumi chain of restaurants.
I never came across any active gang members in my 10+ years living there, just some graffiti every once in awhile. Then again, I lived in what some may call the nicer part of Gardena. My elementary school (Chapman Elementary) received the California Distinguished school award and was ethnically diverse. In fact, I've never found another city as ethnically diverse as Gardena.
My suggestion is to do some research. There are websites that can help you determine things like crime rate in any city that can help you pinpoint where in Gardena you would like to live. I would highly recommend moving there as long as you do your research.

I adopted both of my buns from http://www.rabbitrescue.com/. They are a wonderful rescue, taking in expectant mothers and even rabbits with medical issues. They are located in Southern California and also accept online donations.

WRITING.TITLE: Just need to rant...
WRITING.TEXT:
Today was an awful day.
It was supposed to be a great day because my kids put on a play showing off their awesome reading skills to their parents and other students at the school (my kids are in Kindergarten, for the record). Then we received a memo that there would be assemblies and field trips during the day. Also, my full time aide would be pulled out for pretty much all day. He's been pulled from my room every day for the past week, so I shouldn't have been surprised.
Why is this a big deal? Well, because I have a class of 30 kids and he's in charge of our stage crew who are designing costumes, scenery, and props so everyone is involved in the play. Since he keeps getting pulled out, we haven't gotten practice or to finish those things. There was an aide who offered to help, but she didn't finish until 30 minutes after all of the parents and students had arrived to watch the performance. I had to improve while waiting. I ended up leading everyone in nursery rhymes and Simon Says. Not to mention a student cut herself with fabric scissors she found laying around so deeply that she wouldn't stop bleeding for like 10 minutes.
I'm sure it wasn't as bad as I thought it was, but it's frustrating planning all of these fun things and then not being ready because admin decides to pull my aide and change the day. I feel like a failure for not being able to figure it out and be ready for what was supposed to be a great day. In the end, it was probably my stress that made the day not as great as it should have been for the kids. I feel like I have failed my kids by not being prepared. THAT is the worst feeling of all.

I didn't realize she would still smell my rainbow bunny. He had a hard time getting along with the other bunnies at the shelter, the girls kept attacking him. =( Wonder if it has anything to do with that.
Thanks for the perspective about the chin rubbing, I will definitely keep that in mind.

I have spent about $100, but i think less than half of that went toward the matchmaking services. Most of it went to the shelter to help them continue taking care of and feeding the other rabbits - well, and to make sure that I wanted to adopt for the right reasons. http://rabbitrescue.com/matchmaking.html
Will do, thanks!
Thanks for the input, I will definitely use vinegar as a precaution.
I can tell by your flair that you have quite a bit of experience. =) Thumper died from a sudden onset of bloat. I will make sure to disinfect. Do you use vinegar or soap?
It's real! http://rabbitrescue.com/matchmaking.html

WRITING.TITLE: Bonding - new litter box required?
WRITING.TEXT:
Tomorrow, I'm picking up my two bunnies from their bunnymoon with a professional rabbit matchmaker and bonder. I want to make sure that everything is great for them when they come home and that I don't ruin the great bonding they have done over the past week.
One of the pair is a recent widower, so everything I have right now belonged to him his past love. The big rabbit pen that they used as a litter box is one of those items. It is made out of plastic, so my husband says that I should just wipe it down with vinegar and it will be fine, but what do you think? Is a new bunny pair able to use an old litter box that has just been wiped down thoroughly? Should I just buy a new one? As for their cardboard bunny mansion, the bonder says to just reintroduce it after a couple of weeks - but I still wonder about that too.
Tris and Four from the Divergent series.
[relevant](http://youtu.be/X2LTL8KgKv8)

This list is going to be all over the place, but I guess for me it's all about the world building.
Pan's Labyrinth, Amelie, The Hunger Games movies, The Matrix, District 9, Let the Right One In, Scott Pilgrim vs. The World, Kill Bill vol. 1, Watchmen, Inception, Divergent, The Secret Life of Walter Mitty.

You need to discuss it when she is calmer and more open to new ideas. My husband is the same way, and we have gotten to the point now where I can call him out on it, it just takes him awhile to deescalate. It only happened after laying the groundwork beforehand, though.

WRITING.TITLE: Newspaper scammers
WRITING.TEXT:
I have lived here for a couple of years now, and have had the occasional teen trying to sell newspaper subscriptions at my door. Didn't think much of it until today when a grown man tried to do the same thing. After I told him I'd heard the pitch before about trying to fund raise for his school, he told me he just got out of juvie and his parole officer was making him do this so he could go to college. Total bullshit. When I told him that I wasn't interested and didn't have anything for him, he told me he wasn't begging because he wasn't a bum. I said "Good Luck" and closed the door on him. Anyway, it was very disconcerting - especially after reading about people doing this and then burglarizing houses. I haven't experienced that yet, but it's still a scary thought.
Has anyone else experienced this? Also, why does this happen here? When I lived in L.A., I never got door-to-door scammers like this.

I pretty much love all styles of pixie, but am torn between getting a pixie and a bob. My biggest concern is that it won't look good on my face shape and with my glasses. I've spent hours scouring Pinterest for different styles, and just couldn't settle on one. My hair is wavy and will not stay straight if it is humid out, so I am hoping for something that looks good wavy and is possibly longer in the front. I would prefer something low maintenance, but will spend extra time if necessary. I am a Kindergarten teacher, so I am hoping for something that looks professional as well.

That makes sense.
I'm an elementary school teacher, and I am often at conferences and various professional developments. Although I have met a few people, I haven't made any contacts that could help me find a job with a public district. Most of the people I have met also work at charter schools (they're very big here in L.A.).

I'm married and a homeowner now, so stepping backwards into a sub position is not an option. Plus, I already had to sub my first year with a credential and that's how I found this teaching job. That was 6 years ago.
I have a clear credential and meet all of the Edjoin requirements. The job I have now was through a sub job, but I still have not found any district work in the 6 years I've been looking.

WRITING.TITLE: For the Portal fans out there - Slightly spoilery for The Scorch Trials
WRITING.TEXT:
*Also spoilery for those of you who haven't played Portal 2 yet!
Did you picture [this guy](http://media.steampowered.com/apps/portal2/comic/part1/p01.jpg) when you were reading The Scorch Trials like I did?

WRITING.TITLE: So-Cal Charter School Teacher: The struggle of getting a district position.
WRITING.TEXT:
I have been stuck at the same charter school for 6 years now, and I would love to get a district job. Everyone I know who has left my school has gone to another charter school, and every time I apply for a position at a public school I don't hear back - not even a call.
I have no idea why that is - are there no positions for newer teachers? Am I somehow undesirable as someone who's worked at a charter school for so long?
For any of you who have been in similar situations or can answer my questions, please let me know. I am starting to think that I will be stuck at this school forever.

In my Kindergarten class, I probably do somewhere between 5-10 brain breaks in a day (we have full day Kinder). I use it during transitions between subjects, and any time I notice them getting squirmy in their seats (which can be in the middle of a long lesson sometimes). The website says they have brain breaks up to the 8th grade - you should definitely check it out!
I'd like to think that's how they really are - I mean, they'd have to be pretty awesome and silly to come up with all of that stuff!
Our favorite is a brand new one called "Secret Handshakes." Now whenever I'm giving kudos to the kids, I give them a jellyfish.
Someone finally got the reference! Thanks for making my day. ;)
You should cross post to the [Rabbits](http://www.reddit.com/r/Rabbits/) subreddit. Good luck!
I adopted a rabbit from rabbitrescue.com a few years ago and it is a nice place. They even have a set up outside for the bunnies to run around in with toys. They do bunny matchmaking as well!

WRITING.TITLE: Great, Free Brain Break Resource for Elementary Teachers - Enjoy!

WRITING.TEXT: I just finished it today and enjoyed it. I was extremely intrigued by the world the series created and even more so when I found out that Chicago was an experiment. To me, Tris offering to go in Kaleb's place was foreshadowed in her previous sacrifices, but a sign of maturity and her nature as Abnegation like her parents. She would not be Tris if she had let her brother die. To be honest, I was also curious about whether or not she would be able to fight off the death serum. She was stubborn to the end. If Kaleb had gone instead, he would have died via death serum before ever pushing the button, and the sacrifice of his life would be for naught. After she died, the dual narration all made sense and everything clicked into place. It was well-written, in my opinion.
It actually looks like it's moving faster with the music!
Thanks for teaching me something new! =)
I think Howard is a she... isn't that a dewlap?

As soon as Tenzin decided not to become a hostage, he sealed his fate. The conversation Zuko had with Korra regarding what Aang would do in this situation was foreshadowing - he would do anything to protect the Air Nation. Tenzin will most definitely give up his life to save the Air Nation and his family. The Red Lotus are taking out leaders, so Tenzin fits that category as well. Perhaps this turn of events is one of the reasons Nick doesn't want to air the episodes - too dark for the little ones.

Having the child or having an abortion is your choice, but either way you need to get a divorce ASAP. If you have the child, the first thing you should do is file for sole custody. If your husband verbally abused you, it's very likely that he would do the same with a child.
Then tell your family everything. Under the given circumstances, they should be there to support and understand you. You have zero reason to do anything this man says. He has hurt you in so many ways and you owe him nothing but payback for how he mistreated you. You deserve so much better, but need to take action before you can get to that better place.
This is a good explanation. For more information, look up Roberta Sparrow's book The Philosophy of Time Travel - it's a DVD extra and you can probably find it online too.
Was this in California, or another state? That's good to know, but sucks for me.

It's true. And a lot of teachers who did get jobs in districts got pink slips. Last hired, first fired. One of my Master Teachers was a recently displaced Assistant Principal for LAUSD and many subs were retired teachers. If that's happening, then there must not be much room for new teachers. Then again, that was 6 years ago. Hopefully things will change soon...

Thanks for the info. I'll definitely remember that next time I put in an application.
When you say supervisor, do you mean the district HR contact person they last with the application, or someone else?
No... what is the best course of action when following up with a large district, though?
I took the coursework and passed the CSET for English, but I still haven't filled out the paperwork to clear it. So technically, yes.

Are you working at a charter school? I created my own curriculum for my first five years. This was at a brand new charter school. We had purchased curriculum the first year we opened, but it was used more as a resource bank because we realized it didn't fit in with our school's particular philosophy. We are finally adopting new curriculum for the Common Core this year.

Agreed. The more you can get into a classroom with students BEFORE you have your own classroom, the better. Classroom management is one of the things new teachers struggle with the most, and it can only be learned through experience.

Rubistar is a great place to create rubrics, but it also houses a wide array of ready-to-use rubrics in various areas. Hope it helps!
http://rubistar.4teachers.org/index.php

You can organize your lessons/quizzes/tests by Standard for easier access from year to year, or by month/quarter if you have a certain pacing you know will follow from year to year. You can also purchase hanging file folders in different colors to designate different subjects.

I subbed Pre-K to 11 my first year with a multiple subject credential as well. You should be able to, just not 12th grade because it is more specialized content. Like syd_malicious said, you will only be able to long-term sub in the areas you are fully credentialed in. I did a lot of long-term subbing and it helped me land a full-time teaching job. Good luck!

WRITING.TITLE: What is the state of "new teachers" where YOU live?
WRITING.TEXT:
I am a teacher going into my 6th year at a charter school in the Los Angeles area. Pretty much every year I've been at the charter school, I've applied for jobs at public school districts and never received a reponse. While I am excited for the work I am doing where I am, what I would like is to get a more secure job at a public district closer to where I live (Orange County). This year a great district nearby put out an application for potentially 30 positions, and I never heard a word back from them.
I don't consider myself a new teacher, but I wonder what experiences others have had in this area as teachers who have been stuck in the charter system or perhaps even in other states. Every teacher I've met can only find charter school jobs, one even moving as far as Northern California just to have one.

Have you tried heavier toys? Sometimes they just like to have a little resistance, that is to chew something that won't move very much. My buns are obsessed with the hard and heavy hay tunnel I get from the pet store - I get the large one and it lasts about a month for my my buns.

You probably experienced a honeymoon period with him until recently. Now he is more familiar with you and communicating his disapproval with you through nips. Avoid physical contact unless he approaches you and only give pets when his head is down for awhile. To encourage him approaching you, lay still in a space near where he is. It may take time, but be patient and don't get discouraged. This is how you earn trust. I took in a bunny off the street and the same thing happened with her.
It is also natural for rabbits to chew on things as it helps them keep their teeth from overgrowing. I recommend going to a pet shop and providing him with a few options to keep him from damaging furniture - my rabbits love the heavy hay tunnel because it doesn't move much when they chew on it, but every bunny is different. If you have carpet, make sure all of the corners are inaccessible because he may pull it up.
Rescuing bunnies is one of the most rewarding experiences ever, so keep up the good work! =)

LOL... my girl used to wake me up when I didn't have breakfast ready in a timely fashion too. She would pick up her plastic dish and swing it around until the noise was loud enough to wake me up and bring her pellets.

Booping noses is kind of like saying hello in the bunny world. My bonded buns used to do it whenever they would pass each other, but now that they've been together over a year not so much anymore. She should calm down once she gets spayed, the humping could also be an act of dominance.
EDM isn't real music.
I want to be like him when I grow up...
That's scary. What type of advice did he give you so I know what to avoid and watch out for?

Yikes! I have no idea what the protocol is because I've never tried to contact a therapist. All of my medical is through Kaiser, and my general doctor likes to just prescribe me medicine instead of really trying to figure out what's going on - so I doubt she would refer me. =/

Happy Cake Day!
Thank you for the very specific feedback and strategies. I will try my best to incorporate them into my life as well (rabbits may become my thing now). I'm starting to think that I cry when I feel frustrated, especially when I'm trying to get a point across and I can't or I feel completely helpless in any given situation. In terms of conversations, I have no way of knowing if people feel like I don't care when they tell me problems - because most of the time they talk to me once and that's it. The only person in my life who is brutally honest about my social shortcomings is my husband - learning about them at 29 is a bit late in the game.
Thanks for helping me feel a little more hopeful about what a therapist could do for me, even one with very little ASD experience. =)

That's awesome! I'm thinking being diagnosed will be a relief too if I decide to see someone about it.
The exact same thing is happening in my life. All I want is to help, and I'm slowly figuring out how to do that without sounding arrogant and like a know-it-all. I'm not sure if I'd rather have influence over situations or people, because in my workplace the actions and decisions of the people highly inform the systems. I guess the main thing I want to do is turn our campus into a well-oiled machine - I often feel like we waste time on unimportant busy work when we should be problem solving and moving forward. Efficiency.

I will definitely do that. At first I was concerned that people would judge me for joining and not being diagnosed, but it feels like there are a lot of understanding people here who will help whether you're an Aspie or just wondering if you are one.

True. I'm not worried about labeling, in fact my fear is to go and not be labeled as ASD. I've spent all of my life feeling like an outcast who can't get it (social interaction) right no matter how hard I try. It would be nice to feel like I belong somewhere.
My concern in the workplace is better understanding my faults and how to improve myself so that I can make a difference and have a greater impact possibly in a leadership or support role.

WRITING.TITLE: How can getting diagnosed and seeing a psychologist or therapist help a fairly high functioning adult with Asperger Syndrome?
WRITING.TEXT:
First of all, I just have to say that "Aspergers" being squiggly red underlined is really killing me. I even changed it to "Asperger Syndrome" but it was still squiggled. UGH. I think this is a group of like-minded souls, so hopefully some of you will understand and appreciate my sentiment.
As a 29 year old female who always just considered myself socially awkward, I have begun to realize that I may have Aspergers due to other personality traits of mine. As a teacher, I try to be the most positive and professional version of myself at all times (while at work), yet I am always unintentionally angering students, parents, and coworkers or am under the impression that they just don't like me . The only grade level I feel comfortable working with is Kindergarten - I get them and they get me (it's very difficult to offend a Kindergartner because they just say what they mean just like me)! I have a real passion for education reform and have great ideas for improving our school and creating a more effective and efficient workplace - which I try to share with everyone a lot more than I probably should.
However, sharing the first thing that pops into my mind and accidentally offending people is not the best way to effect change or become a leader. I have learned how to control my verbal outbursts in most social settings, but it is damn near impossible when I am so passionate about the subject!
TL;DR: I am considering getting an official diagnosis and doing therapy in order to improve my professionalism in the workplace, but is it worth it? Have any of you been through therapy as an adult diagnosed with Aspergers and had it improve your social standing?

WRITING.TITLE: [Fit Check] First bras that (kinda) fit! What do you think of the fit...?
WRITING.TEXT:
I used to wear a 34B, but my husband convinced me to come here and determine my true bra size. He helped me record measurements and everything, so I've measured myself to a 30F/FF by U.K. sizes. I live in the U.S. so there weren't really any places to shop nearby and I had to purchase online. To make matters worse, I also realize that I measured myself in the middle of my cycle which is supposed to be when breasts swell up.
Some of you lovely ladies recommended bra styles for narrow, even, and projected breasts. After trying these on, I'm not sure if I'm as even as I thought I was (or maybe the size is just too large).
These are pictures of me in the Panache Jasmine: [30FF Front](http://i.imgur.com/AdOkyOx) and [30FF Side](http://i.imgur.com/cBPdqod)
and the Cleo Lily, which fits better but still seems a little loose at the top even after the scoop and swoop. The underwire is also somewhat digging into my sternum, leaving marks: [30F Front](http://i.imgur.com/Rw0NJH6) and [30F Side](http://i.imgur.com/vJkp5LX)
So what are my next steps? Are there any other sizes/brands/styles you would recommend?

As others said, having a routine and sticking to it faithfully is crucial. Your first few weeks should be focused on getting those routines and procedures in order with fewer academics. Also, get to know your kids and let them get to know you. You should also provide time for "brain breaks," which are short spurts of time the kids can just relax so they can focus better on learning throughout the day. Check GoNoodle.com for some cool ones you can do with the kids.
This is exactly what I was hoping to see done with the picture.
Check out the Downtown Fullerton area!

The Panache Jasmine came in, and
1) I'm not even as I thought, I'm not very full on top, and
2) I made the mistake of doing this in the middle of my period - never realized that my breasts swell up during that time
Wearing a 30 felt wonderful, even though the straps were kind of uncomfortable. I'm not sure why that was, although they seemed to hit wider than I'm used to (closer to the shoulder than evenly between my neck and shoulder). I'm hoping the 30F fits better than the 30FF. If not, do you know which styles are better for full on the bottom and not-so-much on top?
Edit: Just looked up the scoop and swoop - now only a little big at the top! This will do nicely as a period bra.
I got it at Rabbit Rescue, which is also where I adopted my second bunny. They don't sell items online, but I purchased it when I adopted him.

That's so beautiful! I would love to build something more permanent, but my bunnies love their 4 story Maze Haven mansion. They're really big on remodeling, so I just change out the cardboard every so often (that way they're not remodeling MY furniture, if you know what I mean...).
https://fbcdn-sphotos-g-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xfp1/t31.0-8/906294_10101671186815081_636753074_o.jpg
https://fbcdn-sphotos-e-a.akamaihd.net/hphotos-ak-xaf1/t31.0-8/738227_10101469981537071_587479611_o.jpg
Here is the link to the wonderful site that sells Maze Haven as well as other bunny necessities!
http://www.binkybunny.com/STORE/tabid/163/Default.aspx
Please explain "rated R" sex for me. ELI5.
Careless Whisper by George Michael... is my age showing yet?
Where did that clip come from?!

*binge watching shows on Netflix.
There, FIFY.

My bunnies hate being put on their backs, so I found a way to minimize the time I put them in the bunny burrito (covering their eyes and petting their heads for a bit while they are in burrito does seem to calm them down a bit though). My shower has a little seat on it that's the perfect size for a bunny to lay on, so I put them up there to clip their front paws. I let them get comfortable and then clip their front nails one at a time, turning them to the side for better access. They were squirmy at first, but they got the hang of it after awhile. The back nails still need to be trimmed in a burrito, though. Sometimes I hold them under an arm, but other times I hold them between my thighs so I have the usage of both hands.
Thank you for the pictures and insight about UK vs. US sizes!
Thank you for the pictures!
This video was definitely affirming - and now I want that top too! LOL... thanks!
Thanks for letting me know about Dillard's, I will definitely check them out. Is there a particular bra from them that you prefer or style that you liked best?
Thank you for your specific feedback. I just purchased a Cleo Lily in 30F and a Panache Jasmine in 30FF so I can get a feel for which is best.

WRITING.TITLE: [Measurement Checks] From 34B to 30F/FF... really?!
WRITING.TEXT:
I did the measurements, but am still in disbelief about the results. I actually had measurements done at Victoria's Secret years ago and she told me I was 36A. I always wore 34B, but most of the bras I used at that size didn't fit properly. Anytime I wore a bra that was less than full coverage, I would be spilling out.
I used the 5 measurement numbers and the site provided which say that the 30F/FF in UK terms actually translates to 30G in the US - where I am from. Here are the numbers I came up with for measurements (in inches):
1. 29.5 2. 27.25 3. 35.5 4. 38 5. 36
Also just found out that my breasts are projected, narrow, and even using the other measurement charts here.
